Object.Description: Unique catalogue internal record number for the object
Over-arching object type, currently all records have the value of object
Object.Notes: Currently all values are object. See GitHub #23 in future development.

Object.Description: Type of object with the primary object type listed first, with a secondary object type listed on occasions.
Additional object type, listed under
Title given to the object
Catalogue internal record number for the collection
API entity type for the collection

Object.Where_to_find_in_EMu: Accession Lots module > Acquistion Tab > Collection name
Object.Description: The name of the collection
Accession number assigned to the object
Used by the API to determine if the object is a parent.
Object.Notes: Confirm that this is used by the API to determine if the object is a parent.

Object.Description: Physical material types in the object
Object.Notes: Does EMu have source AAT IDs - no

Object.Description: API entity type for the dimensions
Length of the object
Object.Notes: Could there be decimals? Karen believes there might be in weight. TBC.

Object.Description: Height of the object
Width of the object
Depth of the object (dimension)
Diameter of the object
Weight of the object
Unit type for the object's size measurements
Object.Notes: mm | MM | cm | m

Object.Description: Unit type for the object's weight
Object.Notes: g | kg | tonne | oz | lb

Object.Description: Description of the object and its signficance.
Object.Examples: This hat was worn by Muriel McPhee. McPhee's family believe that around 1916 McPhee became engaged, although they don't know to whom. They believe he was killed on the Western Front. Following the loss of her fiancé during the First World War, McPhee wore black clothing and accessories as a reminder of her loss and grief. They are signifiers of her unstated yet lifelong mourning.
Object.Notes: LA suggests AAT 300080091 'description (activity)' FW changed display label to: Description

Object.Description: Physical description of the object
Object.Notes: LA suggests AAT 300080091 'description (activity)'

Object.Where_to_find_in_EMu: Title Tab > Accession Lot module (click on blue arrow next to accession lot) > SoS Public
Object.Description: Describes the collection in which the objects belongs and its significance.
Object.Examples: This collection consists of a number of objects relating to the life of Muriel McPhee (1899 -1986). These include shoes, a hat and hatbox, gold bracelet and ring, mourning brooch, WWI era cards and photographs, lamp, women's clothing and undergarments, stockings, gloves, handmade post-partum abdominal binder and breast-feeding camisole, grocers invoices and hand-embroidered doily.

Object.Description: Information about the object of educational value
Object.Examples:
This is a plaster death mask of the head of bushranger Ned Kelly, including the neck and partial right shoulder.
Ned Kelly was hanged at Melbourne Gaol on the morning of 11 November 1880. Immediately after his body was taken down from the gallows, his hair and beard were shaved off and a mould taken of his head by Maximilien Kreitmayer. The mask is a unique three-dimensional representation of one of Australia's better-known historical figures, created shortly after his death...
Object.Notes: Labelled Educational Significance in the Emu frontend

Object.Description: EMu module that continas the parties
(container element)

Object.Where_to_find_in_EMu: Parties module > IRN in top right
Object.Description: Catalogue internal record number for the creator
Object.Notes: Discussed using creator but decided to use contributor as this is more ocmmonly used, and not all production parties will be creators.

Object.Where_to_find_in_EMu: Parties module > Person or Organisation tab > Party Type
Object.Description: The type of creator. This will either be a person or an organisation.

Object.Where_to_find_in_EMu: Parties module > Person or Organisation tab
Object.Description: The name of the creator
The role this creator played in creating the object
Notes about this part of creating the object
Object.Examples: There are other branches noted: London, Melbourne and Brisbane.

Object.Description: The type of action taken by the creator
Object.Notes: Inserted into DC (not CRM) to flag production events

Object.Notes: DC Jan 2019 - does this field exist in EMu?

Object.Description: Used to decide if the relationship is to be included in the API. Currently if this value=api then it can be included. However we wish to change this as I do not see why we would resirct showing a relationship in the API. TBC.
Object.Notes: Details TBC re whether this needs an exclusion.

Object.Description: Which API related object is in: Public
(container element)
API entity type for the web link
Label for the web link
URL to any related links or references
Object.Notes: Can be v2.0

Object.Description: List of notes of type ‘Web Link’ put into the objects ‘Notes’ tab
Object.Notes: Can be v2.0

Object.Description: Yes/No field - denotes if it's an item of interest. Could be used to display object on a homepage
Public | Public Restricted | Internal
Object.Notes: This is primarily for filtering content, however both APIs need to include this field in each record. If the record is 'Removed' it is embedded in the record. Note - the "Public Restricted" was to identify those records that we may not reelase without a key. However I think this is out of scope for this project, but worth keeping this field in as it may have uses in the future, and will def be used for the internal API.

Object.Description: If we should show 640x640 on CE, might have to investigate why we have this field and it’s function
Object.Notes: Not applicable for the API, as this indicates whether an image on Collection Explorer needs to be restricted in size. However, the API uses the Creative Commons fields so does not need this.

Object.Description: Yes/No field - used to identify if the object is published on Collection Explorer
Object.Notes: For internal APi only as public API will only include objects published to CE

Object.Description: If the object has at least one image release to the web from EMu. i.e. the lower resolution image.
Object.Notes: This field does not need to be included in the API metadata, however it may help you filter the images as htis shows which ones have an EMu image.
Also P2_has_type of nma:emu-mage, nma:piction-image, nma:preferred

Object.Description: NMA EMu Catalogue record number for the media
API entity type for the media
URI for the rights or licence for media representations of the object
Object.Notes: Fw - rights needs to differentiate between the image and textual data. See DC summary info doc. I think the CC status should also be represented as a Creative Commons status of the image, so users can easily search for images of a particular status. FW 17/5/18 - I think the rights is OK as is, as it refers to the images. And the license ref is where we put the rights for the text.

Object.Description: Label for the rights or licence for media representations of the object
Object.Examples: Public Domain; CC BY-SA 4.0; CC BY-NC-SA 4.0; Copyright not evaluated; Copyright undetermined; All Rights Reserved
Object.Notes: Fw - rights needs to differentiate between the image and textual data. See DC summary info doc. I think the CC status should also be represented as a Creative Commons status of the image, so users can easily search for images of a particular status. FW 17/5/18 - I think the rights is OK as is, as it refers to the images. And the license ref is where we put the rights for the text.

May be used for grouping narratives
Date was first exported from EMu ??
Narrative.Notes: We use this for ordering in CE TBC. If so, then this would also be useful in the API.
Used in CE, probably not needed in public API but needed in internal API.

Narrative.Description: This is used to filter the narratives.
Narrative.Notes: Field to be included in internal API only. Value to be used to filter what narratives are to be included in the public API - only those with "Collection explorer publish". Internal API to include all narratives

Narrative.Description: Narrative body, may contain HTML markup
Subnarratives may be side bars or links within the document

Narrative.Notes: Ignore as we get from the target narrative later

Used in CE to determine if objects in a narrative have been published to the web, and if not, then they do not display in the Set. So ther emay be instances when a narrative has children objects that are not in the API, so some way to exclude these is needed. You could use this field for this, or simply exclude if not able to be found.

Narrative.Description: Values are: Public | Public Restricted | Internal
Narrative.Notes: Used to filter the records. Publlic API to include values of Public and Public Restricted. Internal API to include all records. Both APIs to include the value of this field. TBC as not sure why this is under narratives, maybe it is confirming the API status of the objects in that narrative.

Piction.Description: Object IRN this media file represents

Piction.Notes: Ignore as using object IRN rather than accession no
Ignore as using object IRN rather than accession no

Is this field used much? This field is used to determine the order of images to be diaplayed. It is only populated when there is a preferred order. So if populated, a value of 1 means that should be the preferred image. If not populated, then the first image is the one to use. I know we previously stated that the image order in the XML is the preferred order, but this seems to contradict this. I have made this for v1.0, however if complicated it can wait until v2.0.
Media title is ignored during Solr extraction
